sub_title: United Nations International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Tribunals (UN-IRMCT)- Formerly ICTY
summary: Experienced Legal Project Manager & Case Manager with a demonstrated history of working in the judiciary industry. Skilled in International Law, Administrative Law, Public Speaking, Legal Writing, and Civil Rights. Strong community and social services professional with a Master of Laws (LLM) focused in Human rights, Peace & Conflict from SOAS, University of London.

projects.title: The refugee definition in article 1A(2) of the Refugee Convention reflects a narrow, individualistic, Euro-centric conception of refugees which is ill-equipped to adequately respond to the multiple challenges faced by forced migrants in today’s world.
projects.description: The project was successfully completed as a part of the International Refugee and Migration Law module.

company.name: United Nations International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Tribunals (IRMCT)

profile_positions.company: United Nations International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Tribunals (IRMCT)
profile_positions.description:
• Administrative management of the case (MICT-15-96), including filing of Court documents, maintaining Court files, preparing and finalising exhibits for display in Court
• Disclosure of exhibits to other parties including tracking, collating and indexing of disclosure materials and maintaining disclosure logs
• Assisting in the identification and retrieval of information relevant to the case and maintaining appropriate electronic and physical systems for the organisation of information and evidence
• Maintaining the case calendar
• Performing other tasks as instructed by the Counsel
• Organization of meetings and conferences
•  Liaising with internal and external contacts
• Transmitting (mail, courier, fax, etc),scanning, reproducing and registering documents
• Performing any other tasks as directed, including organization of hearings and other tribunal meetings
• Maintaining eCourt system and uploading documents into eCourt (electronic court)
• Preparing statements of work, final accounts, payroll .
profile_positions.title: Case Manager

profile_positions.description:
Supervisors - Prof. Dr. Rahmat Mohamad  (Secretary General) and S. Pandiyaraj.
o Drafting of notices, memo preparation.
o Compilation of case briefs and research work. 
o Editing, review of articles
o Preparation for journal and conferences
o Extensive work pertaining to the field of International law and Diplomatic law (one such instance is the report on Italian Marines case in India).
profile_positions.title: Legal Trainee

profile_positions.description: Running and maintaining the blog -  updating the blog, writing new articles, editing articles submitted by other students. Blog focussed on core issues in the Indian legal system and published articles analyzing new pieces of acts, legislations passed; and topics of specific interest to legal community such as LGBTI rights, Governance, Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR), etc.
profile_positions.title: Member and Administraor

profile_positions.description:
o Worked on various corporate law and competition law cases (Project Sky, Abbott V Mylan – Major Pharmaceutical Takeover).
o Attended client conferences and made notes for the same.
o Research work related to corporate law and competition law.
o Drafting and reviewing of various contracts and agreements including property lease deed agreements. 
o Extensive work related to procedure for Takeovers as enshrined in the Securities Exchange Board of India (SEBI) (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers) Regulations, 1997 as amended in 2002.
profile_positions.title: Legal Intern

profile_positions.description:
Worked as a legal intern in the Advocacy and Legal Advice Centre (ALAC) wing of Transparency International, India.
o Raising awareness about corruption - advocate legal and policy reforms at national and state levels was the primary area of focus.
o Attended several conferences on the subject matter of anti-corruption laws in India and took notes for the same.
o Did extensive research on anti-corruption laws in India.
o Attended various anti-corruption case proceedings in the court
o Provided Pro-bono legal aid as a part of the legal advice centre.
o Work pertaining to tools of good governance like Right to Information (RTI), Right to Services (RTS).
profile_positions.title: Summer Legal Intern, Advocacy and Legal Advice Centre (ALAC).

company.name: Sidharth Luthra, Senior Advocate, Additional Solicitor General of India (ASG)

profile_positions.company: Sidharth Luthra, Senior Advocate, Additional Solicitor General of India (ASG)
profile_positions.description:
o Attended Supreme Court and Delhi High Court proceedings on a daily basis.
o Attended client conferences and took notes for the same.
o Research work related to a lot of civil and criminal matters including Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) matters.
o Researched and helped in drafting a legal opinion regarding the Supreme Court judgement on the advisory role of AICTE and recognition of long distance courses.
o Worked on a case regarding death sentence being heard in Chief Justice of India (CJI) court (court no.1), Supreme Court of India.
o Extensive research on various facets of procedural and substantive law including the Constitution of India, Code of Criminal Procedure, Indian Penal Code, Indian Evidence Act, Maharashtra Control of Organized Crime Act and the Prevention of Corruption Act.
profile_positions.title: Legal Intern

profile_positions.description:
Legal Intern & Assistant to the Founder - Internship focussing on Contract and Intellectual Property law.
o Study of contracts.
o Research work related to Intellectual Property Rights.
o Drafting of memos and letters.
o Review of employer-employee contracts.
profile_positions.title: Summer Legal Intern

profile_positions.description:
o Research work related to Intellectual Property Rights.
o Compilation of copyright e-books.
o Prepared notes and attended meetings between the company and publishers where terms of copyright settlement were arrived at (management, distribution of revenue, royalty to authors).
profile_positions.title: Legal Intern

profile_positions.description:
Served as an intern in the Governance and Peace-building Unit of International Development Law Organization (IDLO) that offers legal expertise, resources, tools and professional support to governments, multilateral partners and civil society organizations.  As a legal intern I took active participation as a Project Assistant in the implementation and follow-up of the Advanced Course on “Procurement for Large Projects And Private Public Partnerships”.
o Was under the Direct Supervision of Valerie Robert (Lead legal Officer) and Stana Ferrari. 
o Prepared the pre & post project documentation including the project report.
o Worked in collaboration with various international agencies – World Bank, Kuwait fund.  
o Draft of the course report.
o Extensive background research on Public procurement and practices followed by developing nations (guidelines).
profile_positions.title: Legal Intern & Project Assistant
